Class Tab1Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • Controller
      • Tab1Controller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class Tab1Controller
extends Controller
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Class that is used to control everything within the Tab1 'Product Line'. It extends the main controller in which all tabs are located. connects to the database and loads the products on the TableView. can add products to the database as well.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class Controller

        countAM, countAU, countVI, countVM, isThereAProductSelected, lastAdded, productionL, productionLog, productionRun, productLine, productNum, productsDB, productSelected, quantityProduced, tab1, tab2, tab3, tab4

      void connectToDb()
      makes the connection to the database PRODUCT.

      handles the event of the AddProduct button by adding the product to the database PRODUCT.
      void initialize​(java.net.URL location, java.util.ResourceBundle resource)
      This method does whatever happens as soon as the program starts.
      void loadProductList()
      method that loads the database into the tableView on tab1 connects to the database, select the products from it and then load it into a observable list that is going to the tableView.

        public Tab1Controller()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL location,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resource)
        This method does whatever happens as soon as the program starts. add the ItemTypes to the choiceBox. assign the colums to the tableView. opens the date base to load the products already created to the tableView.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

      • handleAddProductButtonAction

        protected void handleAddProductButtonAction​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        handles the event of the AddProduct button by adding the product to the database PRODUCT. Also, loads the database once more so the list of products in the TableView is updated.
        Parameters:
        event - when clicked.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • loadProductList

        public void loadProductList()
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        method that loads the database into the tableView on tab1 connects to the database, select the products from it and then load it into a observable list that is going to the tableView.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • connectToDb

        public void connectToDb()
        makes the connection to the database PRODUCT. reads the user input and add it to the database. and prints the list of database to the console.
